<h2>$ cat welcome!</h2> <p>Hi all. I&rsquo;m currently a PhD Student (since 2011) at the <a href="http://cin.ufpe.br">Federal University of Pernambuco</a>, Brazil, working with <a href="https://sites.google.com/a/cin.ufpe.br/castor">Fernando Castor</a>. During 2013-2014, I was also a visiting scholar at the <a href="binghamton.edu">State University of New York</a>, working with <a href="http://www.cs.binghamton.edu/~davidl">David Liu</a>.</p> <p>My research interests are all related to software engineering/programming languages. Currently, I&rsquo;m trying to understand how parallel programming techniques impact on energy consumption. For instance, since we are moving from 2 to 32, 64 or even 128 cores, how can we save energy knowing that a 32 core processor consumes more power than one with 2 cores?</p> <p>I am interested in new colleagues at all levels: undergraduates, graduate students, and postdocs. If your research interests overlap with mine, please drop me a letter.</p> <h3>$ cat selected_pubs</h3> <ul> <li><p><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/kenan-liu/40/855/29">Kenan Liu</a>, <strong>Gustavo Pinto</strong> and <a href="http://www.cs.binghamton.edu/~davidl/">David Liu</a>. <br/> &ldquo;<a href="http://gustavopinto.github.io/lost+found/fase2015.pdf">Data-Oriented Characterization of Application-Level Energy Optimization</a>&rdquo;. <br/> Accepted to the 18th International Conference on Fundamental Approaches to Software Engineering. (accpt. 28% [23/82])<br/> (<a href="http://www.etaps.org/index.php/2015/fase">FASE</a>), London, UK, 2015. <br/> Download: <a href="http://gustavopinto.github.io/lost+found/fase2015.pdf">[Paper]</a> [Slides]</p></li> <li><p><strong>Gustavo Pinto</strong>, <a href="https://sites.google.com/a/cin.ufpe.br/castor/">Fernando Castor</a> and <a href="http://www.cs.binghamton.edu/~davidl/">David Liu</a>.<br/> &ldquo;<a href="http://gustavopinto.github.io/lost+found/oopsla2014.pdf">Understanding Energy Behaviors of Thread Management Constructs</a>&rdquo;.<br/> Accepted to the 28th ACM Conference on Object-Oriented Programming Systems, Languages, and Applications.
